intro: Sinocarum pseudocruciatum, commonly known as the Chinese crucifix plant, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, cross-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a smooth margin and a slightly hairy underside.
